title: go-ethereum-1.8.2 build failed on CentOS 7.4 and Golang 1.9.1 linux/amd64
body:
Hi there,

I would like to report a build bug.

#### System information

Geth version: 1.8.2 (release)
OS & Version: Linux (CentOS / 7.4)
Go version: 1.9.1 linux/amd64
Commit hash : (if `develop`)

#### Expected behaviour

make geth should return success


#### Actual behaviour

make geth failed.


#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

I attach the short log to illustrate the problem. Kindly tell me if you need any more information.

[root@london-node-224 go-ethereum-1.8.2]# make geth
build/env.sh go run build/ci.go install ./cmd/geth
>>> /usr/local/lib/go/go/bin/go install -v ./cmd/geth
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/common/hexutil

make: *** [geth] Error 1

The following gives a clearer picture of the bug

[root@london-node-224 go-ethereum-1.8.2]# make geth
build/env.sh go run build/ci.go install ./cmd/geth
>>> /usr/local/lib/go/go/bin/go install -v ./cmd/geth
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/vendor/gopkg.in/olebedev/go-duktape.v3
# github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/vendor/gopkg.in/olebedev/go-duktape.v3
vendor/gopkg.in/olebedev/go-duktape.v3/duktape.go:132: constant 18446744073709551615 overflows int64
util.go:45: exit status 2
exit status 1
make: *** [geth] Error 1
possible duplicate of #16120 - please go update and close the issue if this solves your problem
@tamama Yes, @ligi is right, this is a compiler bug in Go 1.9.0 and 1.9.1 I believe. Updating Go should make this issue go away.
